channel.title: Free apps on your Iphone or Ipod Touch
channel.description:
For this to work you need to jailbreak your iphone or ipod touch. If you do not know how to do this, i suggest you use Google to find a guide.
first open cydia
[IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0252.png[/img]
Click manage, then sources.
[IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0253.png[/img]
click edit, then add. [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0254.png[/img]
Write cydia.hackulo.us then click add source [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0255.png[/img]
select the source [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0256.png[/img]
Install Installous [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0257.png[/img]
after you have installed it, open the program [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0258.png[/img]
Find the app you want and download it. [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0259.png[/img]
After you have download it, press the little button where it says downloads, then click on the file you just downloaded. [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0262.png[/img]
select install. [IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb142/lordbost/tut/IMG_0261.png[/img]
EDIT: If you want to synchronize the apps whit itunes, install miPatch

item.title: Free apps on your Iphone or Ipod Touch
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Dumke[AtomicFury”]link=topic=384342.msg3021750#msg3021750 date=1257636030]
wait what?

what do you mean?[/quote]

He means… Jailbreaking AND Updating the firmware is free… I’m aware Apple made some users have to pay to download the new firmware… i think for the touch?

Just go to
http://www.felixbruns.de/iPod/firmware/

Download the new firmware from there… That is a site with every firmware up to date all 3rd party.

Then when you download it… Go onto Itunes and Press and hold “SHIFT” and click “Restore”… Instead of restoring automaticly a box will come up where you can choose which firmware to upgrade to.

Read full topic

item.title: Free apps on your Iphone or Ipod Touch
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:17, topic:290704”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=384342.msg2884735#msg2884735 date=1248542067]

Out of curiosity, how did you take those screen shots?
[/quote]Ummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm same question. I tried the power+home button thing on my ipod but it didn’t work?

http://www.downloadsquad.com/2008/07/16/how-to-take-iphone-or-ipod-touch-screenshots/

It isn’t hard. Hold down the power button and quickly press and release the home button.[/quote]Quite the bugger, actually. I still can’t seem to get it work. Tried pushing the both buttons 1) at the same time, 2) power first then home but no photos were taken =(. Does it matter what kind of firmware version you have etc.?

EDIT: After some researching, it seems that this “screenshot” thing only works on firmwares 2.0 and above.

Read full topic

item.source: Free apps on your Iphone or Ipod Touch

item.title: Free apps on your Iphone or Ipod Touch
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:13, topic:290704”]everyone who has a jailbroken iphone/itouch will have installous its a pretty epic app
ya this is mine

its the one Frell posted, i’ve had for a while now and it wears your battery down because the background is animated[/quote]
I have that now, i downloaded the theme on pc and used diskaid to transfer. You can give any app an icon by renaming the pip boy images. http://www.modmyi.com/forums/new-skins-themes-launches/422631-release-fallout-3-pipboy-3000-theme-4-colors.html Download that one, it lets you rename the images to the app you want them to represent, and you can also remove the scanlines. Use this guide to get it on your phone: http://www.simonblog.com/2009/01/24/how-to-install-winterboard-theme-on-iphone-without-using-cydia/

I also got an ubuntu theme

Read full topic
